eligibility:
Programme Outcomes: 1. To understand the principles of electrochemistry, material science, and including batteries and their management systems, and advanced characterization techniques.
2. To understand the modern tools and methodologies, such as equivalent circuit modelling, electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, and digital twin technology.
3. To apply techniques in cell fabrication, characterization, degradation analysis, battery management algorithms, and verification and validation methodologies to design sustainable, efficient, and reliable battery solutions.
4. To demonstrate the expertise in sustainable and advanced battery technologies and validate innovative solutions for environmental, economic, and technological challenges in energy storage systems.
5. To apply advanced knowledge and skills to design and execute industry-relevant projects in battery materials and Battery Management Systems (BMS), and analyse real-world challenges, synthesize solutions through data-driven approaches, and evaluate project outcomes to propose practical solutions.
Programme Specific Outcomes (PSOs):
PSO1: Understand the concepts of electrochemistry, battery materials, and energy storage principles for application towards cell fabrication, material characterization, and degradation analysis, of batteries.
PSO2: Develop and implement BMS protection features, advanced filtering techniques, and real-time hardware applications using MATLAB, Simulink, and industry-standard platforms.
Programme Educational Objectives (PEOs): Graduates will be able to
1. Gain a strong foundation in battery electrochemistry, energy storage materials, and advanced battery fabrication techniques, with proficiency in material characterization, degradation analysis, and sustainable battery design
2. Develop expertise in battery management system (BMS) algorithms, real-time hardware implementation, and fault diagnosis techniques, and apply digital twin modelling, advanced filtering techniques to optimize battery performance in various applications.
3. Analyse real-world energy storage challenges, develop solutions using data-driven approaches, and develop innovative technologies for sustainable energy solutions. They will be well-positioned for careers in battery materials research, electric vehicle systems, renewable energy storage, and digital twinning applications, as well as pursuing higher education and research in advanced materials and energy technologies.
A minimum of 55% marks in B.Tech/BE in Mechanical Engineering or Automobile Engineering, B.Tech/BE in Chemical Engineering, Instrumentation Engineering, Industrial Production Engineering Instrumentation Engineering, M. Sc. (Physics), M. Sc. (Material Sciences), M. Sc. (Electronics) from a recognized university .
